title: [Large-scale] Self-Regulated Writing Activities and Mobile Collaboration-Based Mathematical Writing Strategy Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of mathematical concepts and experience in secondary education
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers learn to integrate writing activities in mathematics instruction. Emphasizing smartphone-based collaborative tools and self-regulated learning strategies

learning_goals: Learners can systematically document the process of solving mathematical problems by applying self-regulated writing strategies.
They can provide peer feedback and collaborate on mathematical writing tasks with fellow teachers using mobile platforms.
Learners can conduct self- and peer-assessments based on writing quality criteria (e.g., linguistic diversity, idea development).

resources: Mobile-Compatible Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Docs, Padlet)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
